 Preventative maintenance program which is part of the Process Safety Management
program required by the state of Washington and the Federal government
 Written safety procedures and safety equipment which is part of the Process Safety
Management program required by the state of Washington and the Federal government
 Use of accurate and effective written operating procedures which is part of the Process

 Strict adherence to codes and rules in construction and repairs of system components.
C. Five-Year Accident History
The South Baker plant was brought online in October 4th 2017.
There has not been any reportable incident since that date.
D. Emergency Response Program
In addition to the operating procedures, The Company has established Emergency Action
plans for this facility. This plan provides guidance for employees on actions to take in the
event of an ammonia release. These actions include initial action procedures, evacuation
procedures, reporting procedures and control procedures.
The Company will work with the local LEPC to ensure it is aware of the emergency actions
which will be taken in the event of a release at the North Baker facility.
E. Planned Safety Improvements
Through our ongoing implementation of the PSM / RMP program, McDougall & Sons looks
continuously for possible ammonia system changes to improve the safety of our process and
our employees.
We will continue to seek educational opportunities to build on our knowledge to improve
employee's expertise in operating the process.

RMP PROGRAM EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
For McDougall & Sons Inc. South Baker Flats Facility
A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response
The Company's accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, employee training and management practices.
The Company's emergency response plan involves the preparation of action plans and training of employees. The Company's refrigeration personnel are trained in hazardous materials response (24 hours). This training includes emphasis on anhydrous ammonia, in addition to other requirements set forth in 29 CFR 1910.119
At The Company, anhydrous ammonia is used on-site. Ammonia is considered hazardous by EPA and is listed on the Extremely Hazardous Substance (EHS) list. Chemical properties of ammonia make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia in order to:
 Prevent unnecessary human exposure
 Reduce the threat to our personnel
 Reduce the threat to the community
B. Facility and Regulated Substance Handled
McDougall & Sons Inc. South Baker Flats Facility is a fruit cold storage facility, located at 13048 Hwy 2. East Wenatchee, Douglas County, WA 98802. The facility is used as a refrigerated warehouse to hold fruit in storage till it can be packaged for shipment.
The hazardous substances which exceed the threshold quantity IAW EPCRA at South Baker Flats are:
1. Anhydrous Ammonia, AKA NH3, or R717. Anhydrous ammonia is used at the facility as refrigerant. CAS number is 7664-41-7

C. General Accidental Release Prevention Program
The Company's accidental release prevention program is based on the following key
elements:
 High level of training of personnel, using both IIAR and RETA as resources.
 Technology in the form of a remote controls system, through phone land lines and
cellular networks, which allows constant 24 hour monitoring by engineers. System
